title: I think we need Narrative Rioter who uses ask fm
body:
We can ask questions about gameplay, balance, esport, community, technical problems, social systems to Riot on ask fm, why don't we have same think for lore too? You can't explain everything with texts. Ask fm helps so much.

Jaredan ask fm please, thanks.

replies.body:
You got it, Fasmodey!
I'm neck deep in a few things at the moment (only partly due to getting ready for CLG and TSM in Vegas baby, yeah!), but I'll get one set up by ... let's say a deadline of end of next week?

Hold me to it via metaphorical kicks in the shins. Also, if you see me at the Spring Finals, please don't kick me in the shins.

> [{quoted}](name=Jaredan,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=5jJArthb,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2016-04-13T05:34:05.253+0000)
>
> You got it, Fasmodey!
> I'm neck deep in a few things at the moment (only partly due to getting ready for CLG and TSM in Vegas baby, yeah!), but I'll get one set up by ... let's say a deadline of end of next week?
> 
> Hold me to it via metaphorical kicks in the shins. Also, if you see me at the Spring Finals, please don't kick me in the shins.

Just a friendly reminding. {{sticker:slayer-jinx-catface}}
[Boing.](https://ask.fm/RiotJaredan)

I'm too lazy to create an ask account, so I'll leave this here

"Recently Riot has pushed a lot toward including Void and  Void creatures in the new lores, even when is not connected to new Void champ launch/rework (see Mt. Targon recently). What is this due to? Are the preexisting Runeterra places not offering enough ideas for fresh stories?"
The Void is a prominent concern of the powers that be of Targon, that's all. The scale of the Void's threat and the scale of Targon's influence put them in the same sphere of conflict.
Oh cmon, if you have twitter or facebook you can just link those. Or google too.

> [{quoted}](name=Decrit,realm=EUW,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=5jJArthb,comment-id=00000005000000000000,timestamp=2016-04-22T10:59:15.643+0000)
>
> Oh cmon, if you have twitter or facebook you can just link those. Or google too.

I generally hate to link social media accounts to other services, it becomes damn annoying at a certain point

I can understand that, thought lazyness was the only factor here xD

Bella ale ;)

Ahaha 

Bella :D

A me rompe le scatole vedere le quindicimila notifiche di gente che associa giochini del cavolo e altre cose agli account fb e poi intasa le bacheche con notifiche per stupidaggini varie, quindi non solo io non voglio far sapere cosa faccio, ma mi metto pure nei panni altrui che giustamente non vorrebbero vedere le mie di cavolate :D

C'è sempre modo (tranne con le app che sono praticamente virus legali) di impedir loro di spammare la gente.

E' più che altro il dare via la propria identità. A me va anche bene dire a Riot chi sono su FB, ma non dire a FB chi sono su LoL...

we gon' get ban'd for mafffffffia m8s
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EilySQ6AnYQ

But then my Facebook friends will know I play League. The last thing I need is someone I'm friends with in real life asking me to play if they're bad. Cuz I don't want to be mean...but I also don't want to play with you lol.

Lol, same here. But the link itself should not post stuff on your timeline ir communicate it in any way.

But idk, i use twitter for that.

Now we can ask serious and awkward questions that matter.

Like how much sugar do you put in the coffee.

I am evil indeed.
gj, now da answers :D

> [{quoted}](name=Jaredan,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=5jJArthb,comment-id=000000050000,timestamp=2016-04-22T10:00:13.265+0000)
>
> [Boing.](https://ask.fm/RiotJaredan)

I just recollected you and thought about why didn't you create that account for long 2 minutes ago. Then I looked to messages and saw you. Interesting. O.o

But anyway, that's a super good answer. You will be drown in questions tho.
Instructions unclear, spartan kicked jaredan
What if Jaredan ninja-swapped Riot shirts with someone and you just kicked an innocent Rioter that had no idea what was going on?
I think Jaredan would deserve another kick. I will kick every Jaredan until I kick the correct one :3
_slowly backs away and flees_
{{champion:14}} : "COWAAAAAAAAARRRDDD" _ults in opposite direction_

This guy knows there's a Jaredan at the fountain.

Whatever he knows, he knows too much.
I've got an inside source. {{champion:133}} goes behind Rito's lines for me.
I hope you know how many threads about 'narrative breaking promises' you'll get if you don't meet that deadline...
If I see you there can i just give you a hug instead then?
Hugs are welcomed.

That'd be cool. I'd appreciate if you didn't follow one of your colleagues in abandoning Ask.FM and never answering questions anymore after a while. :( (Please poke them and get them to reply to us again ;~; )

wat? ghostcrawler and feralpony reply to answers to this day and do a quite good job. Obviously they have to deal with other stuff but i like how they amnage to get time and stress for that aniway, and not for easy replies!

for example brian has 788 replies https://ask.fm/RiotFeralPony and... omg, i noticed now greg has 1337 replies! Rejoice Greg, is a good time to retire! https://ask.fm/RiotGhostcrawler

Lin on the other hand went quiet for a good while, but he already gave his best aniway with 1345 replies. Even if it' s since a lot, he deserved some rest, probably succumbed to the 1337 reply burnout after a while https://ask.fm/RiotLyte

there are others that do not reply since a while but are also more "niche", like Zenon and Wrekz. Somehow it is understandable that they reply to less questions.

It's RiotLyte I was talking about. There are a great deal of questions I have about player behaviour, and I did ask them but the silence is a bit disappointing since I wanted to know so much but never got an answer. I don't think they're questions that'd help potential offenders avoid punishment; I asked stuff like the reasoning behind not giving feedback about report strength, how the system deals with 'controversial' reports (is "gg ez" reportable or not? Lots of people claim to strongly and fiercely hate it because of low sportsmanship, but is it punishable?), and how the system'd react if community opinion shifted massively over the course of a month, i.e. tomorrow, we all agree that BMing is toxic as hell and start reporting it en masse. How long would it take the system to recognise the new trend and respond accordingly?

I get that he has other stuff to do, but still a bit disappointed since I was so excited.

Now I can excitedly ask Jaredan questions to ignore, though. Kappa.

> [{quoted}](name=Jaredan,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=5jJArthb,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2016-04-13T05:34:05.253+0000)
>
> You got it, Fasmodey!
> I'm neck deep in a few things at the moment (only partly due to getting ready for CLG and TSM in Vegas baby, yeah!), but I'll get one set up by ... let's say a deadline of end of next week?
> 
> Hold me to it via metaphorical kicks in the shins. Also, if you see me at the Spring Finals, please don't kick me in the shins.

WHOA! What a good news.{{sticker:slayer-pantheon-rainbows}} 

Thanks!
fm?

> [{quoted}](name=Arakadia,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=5jJArthb,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2016-04-15T05:06:45.557+0000)
>
> fm?

https://ask.fm/RiotFeralPony

ask fm of FeralPony. Basically a permanent Q&A site.
If you don't mind me asking, what exactly is 'ask fm'?

It's basically a site for Q&A. People can write in questions to other people, who answer them. 

I know both [FeralPony](https://ask.fm/RiotFeralPony) and [Ghostcrawler](https://ask.fm/RiotGhostcrawler) both have active ones, from Riot. Zenon and Lyte have them, but the last time they responded was months ago.
I agree. However, they said they're working on an internal solution so that you can ask questions to Reds directly.
